org.jcvi.jillion.internal.align

Class AbstractSequenceAlignmentBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends ResidueSequence<R,S,B>,B extends ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S>,A extends SequenceAlignment<R,S>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.internal.align.AbstractSequenceAlignmentBuilder<R,S,B,A>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - the Residue type used.
    S - the ResidueSequence type used.
    A - the SequenceAlignment used.
    B - the ResidueSequenceBuilder used.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<A>, SequenceAlignmentBuilder<R,S,B,A>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NucleotideSequenceAlignmentBuilder, ProteinSequenceAlignmentBuilder

    public abstract class AbstractSequenceAlignmentBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends ResidueSequence<R,S,B>,B extends ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S>,A extends SequenceAlignment<R,S>>
extends Object
implements SequenceAlignmentBuilder<R,S,B,A>
    AbstractSequenceAlignmentBuilder is an abstract implementation of SequenceAlignmentBuilder that handles all the dirty work of building a valid SequenceAlignment. Subclasses only have to implement a few simple helper methods to return the correct types.
    Author:
    dkatzel

        public AbstractSequenceAlignmentBuilder(boolean builtFromTraceback)
        Constructs a new instance of a SequenceAlignmentBuilder.
        Parameters:
        builtFromTraceback - this alignment will be built from data collected from some kind of traceback algorithm. This will change the behavior of how the query and subject alignment ranges are computed.
        See Also:
        setAlignmentOffsets(int, int)

      • setAlignmentOffsets

        public SequenceAlignmentBuilder<R,S,B,A> setAlignmentOffsets(int queryOffset,
                                                             int subjectOffset)
        Sets the offset of the first base in the alignment into the full length input sequence. This value is used to compute the values returned by SequenceAlignment.getQueryRange() and SequenceAlignment.getSubjectRange(). If this method is never called, then the start offset is assumed to be 0 for both the query and subject. If this object was constructed with the builtFromTraceback flag set to true, then this offset is actually the end coordinate of this alignment and the start coordinate is computed by subtracting the ungapped alignment length from these input values.
        Specified by:
        setAlignmentOffsets in interface SequenceAlignmentBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends ResidueSequence<R,S,B>,B extends ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S>,A extends SequenceAlignment<R,S>>
        Parameters:
        queryOffset - the offset into the query sequence.
        subjectOffset - the offset into the subject sequence.
        Returns:
        this.
